subject: Travel
title: The Thai Wai
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Thai Wai.

hook.text: In Thailand, pressing your palms together and bowing is called the wai. It doubles as hello and thank you.

buildup.text: The higher your hands, the more respect you show. For monks, hands go to the forehead.

discovery.text: Children wai adults first. You never wai someone younger or of lower social status before they wai you.

twist.text: Tourists wai everyone, including waiters and taxi drivers. Thais find it amusing but appreciate the effort.

climax.text: Fast-food chains in Thailand have mascots doing the wai. Ronald McDonald stands with palms pressed.

punchline.text: Even Ronald McDonald respects Thai customs.

quiz.question: What does raising your hands higher during a Thai wai signify?
